results.title: Simvastatin relieves myocardial ischemia/reperfusion injury in rats through hedgehog signaling pathway.
results.text_hl: Before operation, the @SPECIES_10116 @@@rats@@@ in I/@<m>DISEASE_Ring_Chromosome_20_Syndrome</m> @DISEASE_MESH:C580424 @@@R@@@ + @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@Sim@@@ group were administered with @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@Sim@@@ at 10 mg/kg/d through oral gavage for 7 d.

citations.NLM: Feng L, Lai QM, Zhou GM, Yang L, Shi TY, Jiang L, Wang HF. Simvastatin relieves myocardial ischemia/reperfusion injury in rats through hedgehog signaling pathway. Eur Rev Med Pharmacol Sci. 2020 Jun;24(11):6400-6408. PMID: 32572937

results.title: Simvastatin-loaded nano-niosomes confer cardioprotection against myocardial ischemia/reperfusion injury.
results.text_hl: Our findings have suggested that nano-niosomes can be applied as a notable drug delivery method to augment stability, bioavailability, and therapeutic efficacy of @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@SIM@@@, when it used against @<m>DISEASE_Ring_Chromosome_20_Syndrome</m> @DISEASE_MESH:C580424 @@@myocardial I/R injury@@@.

citations.NLM: Naseroleslami M, Niri NM, Akbarzade I, Sharifi M, Aboutaleb N. Simvastatin-loaded nano-niosomes confer cardioprotection against myocardial ischemia/reperfusion injury. Drug Deliv Transl Res. 2022 Jun;12(6):1423-1432. PMID: 34165730

results.title: Simvastatin attenuates intestinal ischemia/reperfusion induced injury in rat.
results.text_hl: This study investigated the effect of @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ administration in a warm intestinal I@<m>DISEASE_Ring_Chromosome_20_Syndrome</m> @DISEASE_MESH:C580424 @@@/R@@@ model on @GENE_TNF @GENE_24835 @@@TNF-alpha@@@, antioxidant enzymes and intestinal tissue morphology.

citations.NLM: Hajipour B, Somi MH, Saberifar F, Hemmati MR, Asl NA, Moein A, Vatankhah AM, Nourazar AR, Nasirizade MR. Simvastatin attenuates intestinal ischemia/reperfusion induced injury in rat. Folia Morphol (Warsz). 2009 Aug;68(3):156-62. PMID: 19722159

results.title: Simvastatin inhibits inflammation in ischemia-reperfusion injury.
results.text_hl: Our results suggest that @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ may be an effective protectant against @DISEASE_Soft_Tissue_Injuries @DISEASE_MESH:D017695 @@@tissue injury@@@ associated with I@<m>DISEASE_Ring_Chromosome_20_Syndrome</m> @DISEASE_MESH:C580424 @@@/R

citations.NLM: Zhao Y, Feng Q, Huang Z, Li W, Chen B, Jiang L, Wu B, Ding W, Xu G, Pan H, Wei W, Luo W, Luo Q. Simvastatin inhibits inflammation in ischemia-reperfusion injury. Inflammation. 2014 Oct;37(5):1865-75. PMID: 24912811

results.title: Effects of simvastatin on lung injury induced by ischaemia-reperfusion of the hind limbs in rats.
results.text_hl: The control and I/R group @SPECIES_10116 @@@rats@@@ received placebo (water) instead of @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@. The lungs of the I@<m>DISEASE_Ring_Chromosome_20_Syndrome</m> @DISEASE_MESH:C580424 @@@/R@@@ @SPECIES_10116 @@@rats@@@ showed marked histopathological changes compared with the other groups.

citations.NLM: Sun XF, Wang LL, Wang JK, Yang J, Zhao H, Wu BY, Wang YF, Wang L. Effects of simvastatin on lung injury induced by ischaemia-reperfusion of the hind limbs in rats. J Int Med Res. 2007 Jul-Aug;35(4):523-33. PMID: 17697530

results.title: Simvastatin attenuates renal ischemia/reperfusion injury from oxidative stress via targeting Nrf2/HO-1 pathway.
results.text_hl: The present study assessed the efficacy of @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ in preventing I@<m>DISEASE_Ring_Chromosome_20_Syndrome</m> @DISEASE_MESH:C580424 @@@/R@@@-induced @DISEASE_Kidney_Diseases @DISEASE_MESH:D007674 @@@renal injury@@@ in a @SPECIES_10116 @@@rat@@@ model and investigated the corresponding molecular mechanisms.

citations.NLM: Zhang Y, Rong S, Feng Y, Zhao L, Hong J, Wang R, Yuan W. Simvastatin attenuates renal ischemia/reperfusion injury from oxidative stress via targeting Nrf2/HO-1 pathway. Exp Ther Med. 2017 Nov;14(5):4460-4466. PMID: 29067120
